'Aerospace Defense Command' is an inactive United States Air Force Major
Command. Established in 1946 under the United States Army Air Force, its mission
was to organize and administer the integrated air defense system of the
Continental United States (CONUS), exercise direct control of all active
measures, and coordinate all passive means of air defense.

The command was inactivated on 31 March 1980.
